name: Totem
description: A personal and unique item used to test reality and self-awareness within dreams.

content.title: Overview
content.body: A **totem** is a personal, unique item that characters in **Inception** use to test their own sense of reality within dreams. Its primary purpose is to help the owner determine whether they are in a dream or the real world.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: Each totem is unique to its owner and has a specific weight, balance, and feel that only the owner knows. This distinctness prevents others from using it accurately when trying to manipulate the dream world.

content.title: Function
content.body: The totem functions as a reality test. In the film, Dom Cobb's (Leonardo DiCaprio) totem is a spinning top that, if it continues to spin indefinitely, indicates that Cobb is in a dream. Conversely, if it topples, it signals he is in reality. The unique properties of a totem ensure that only the owner can accurately interpret its state.

content.title: History
content.body: The concept of the totem is introduced to the team by **Dom Cobb** and is used by each member to maintain their grip on reality. Cobbâ€™s totem, the spinning top, originally belonged to his wife, **Mal Cobb** (Marion Cotillard), and becomes a symbol of his ongoing struggle with distinguishing dreams from reality.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The totem is crucial to the narrative of **Inception** as it represents the characters' constant battle to determine what is real. It becomes a pivotal plot point in the climax of the film, where its final spin leaves the audience questioning the nature of Cobb's reality.
